title: Bill Huang
description: Hi, I'm Bill. I do stuff on the internet.
aboutlong:
My name is Bill Huang...
I was raised in the wintery city of Calgary, Alberta. In 2013, I left my hometown for Waterloo, Ontario in order to pursue an undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering. I have always possessed an interest for technology and this degree allows me to sate my curiosity.
If you have any questions or concerns, I can be reached through email at any time.
aboutshort: I am a fullstack software engineer interested in Frontend Web Design and Android application development. I am passionate about delivering the best possible experience to the end user. I am currently studying Computer Engineering at the University of Waterloo.
name: Yichen Bill Huang

values.description: Maintain readability and uphold good coding practices.
Actively seek feedback to incorporate into my work.
Strive for simplicity but not at the cost of quality.
Embrace failure as part of the learning process.
Constantly strive to become a better developer and help others become better developers.
Always have a road map for future functionality and scalability. Never build blindly.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.descriptionShort: At Amazon, I was a part of the WebVideo team (formerly the YouTube team). When Google blocked YouTube from Amazon devices, we transitioned into displaying WebVideos from various sources (Vimeo, DailyMotion). With the WebVideo team, we pushed out a production ready product in 2 months to millions of Echo Show users.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.descriptionShort: At Connected Lab, I aided product managers in translating technical requirements into a long term development plan and estimating development effort for each solution. I worked on a variety of web/mobile/server projects for numerous clients during my time here.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.descriptionShort: I helped build an internal resource management tool using the PERN stack (Postgres, Express, React, Node). Express was used for routing  I also performed RnD on the capabilities of React Native.
experiences.description: Connected Lab is a company that is building standalone mobile and web apps, while increasingly building ‘connected software’ across multiple devices and environments. At Connected Lab, I worked on the connected allocations web tool. The allocations web tool is an internal tool used by Connected Lab for resource, client, and project management. Functionalities for report/invoice generation was also implemented during my time at Connected. This project used ReactJS on a Node Framework. Swig was used for HTML templating PostgreSQL and Sequelize was used for the back end.

experiences.title: Frontend Developer
experiences.descriptionShort: While at nanoPay, I implemented UI/UX of an Android app as well as using AngularJS to build a responsive website with Rest API. I worked closely with designers to implement the designs and was responsible for high code quality.
experiences.description: nanoPay is a relatively new startup company that streamlines checkout and creates a smoother shopping experiences by delivering loyalty, coupons and payment with a single touch. I have had the pleasure to work for nanoPay as a Front End Developer, spending my time creating the loyalty portal that the clients of nanoPay will use. Here, I gained significant experience in development using AngularJS and also the Continuous Integration Software Development Cycle. I also started development on an mobile app for android using Android Studio.

experiences.title: Project Coordinator
experiences.description: The Kearl Expansion Project is an oil sands mine in the Athabasca Oil Sands Region in northern Alberta. I feel lucky to have played a part in both the construction portion as well as the quality control portion for the Electrical Heat Trace of this project. Here I learned more about the turnover to client process as I have worked at Kearl to it's completion in terms of EHT.

experiences.title: Project Coordinator
experiences.description: I have had the pleasure to have been apart of the team that is currently constructing the worlds largest Steam-assisted gravity drainage (or SAGD) facility in the world. Here, I gained extensive knowledge and experience with regards to Project Coordination and Project planning.

experiences.title: Health Intern
experiences.description: I spent the summer of 2012 working for Alberta Health Services as a dietician intern. A fellow intern and I lead a research project on celiac disease as well as working on a celiac disease support group.

projects.name: Morse Code Translator
projects.description: Takes in string inputs and outputs morse signals. Programmed using an ARM board and assembly language.

projects.name: Alexa Rap Bot
projects.description: Node project that uses AWS Lambda and DynamoDB to create an application that allows you to participate in a rap battle with Alexa.

projects.name: TapExchange
projects.description: TapExchange is a simple phone app that allows users to transmit contact info via NFC.

projects.name: Blogging Site
projects.description: A Blogging website created from scratch for a friend.

projects.name: Android Pedometer
projects.description: Designed and implemented Android Pedometer using finite state machines and sensor event handlers. Contains map loading and path finding capabilities.

projects.name: Reaction Timer
projects.description: Designed a program using the ARM board that records the reaction time of user based on LED stimulus and button input.

projects.name: Traffic light system
projects.description: Designed and programmed a 4-way traffic light system on a FPGA board using VHDL programming language

projects.name: Pong
projects.description: A Recreation of the classic game of Pong using Unity.

projects.name: Portfolio sites
projects.description: Portfolio style website created using Node, Express and Pug

projects.name: Casty
projects.description: A household movie queue and streaming device for the raspberry pi.

projects.name: Palette
projects.description: Analyzes an image/camera feed and grabs a custom color palette
